intro: Eriogonum effusum subsp. nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as hillsides and sagebrush steppe. It is part of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is known for its adaptability to arid environments. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct morphological and ecological characteristics compared to other Eriogonum species.
